locally_integrable_on_of_locally_integra:
/-- If `f` is locally integrable with respect to `Î¼.restrict s`, it is locally integrable on `s`.
(See `locally_integrable_on_iff_locally_integrable_restrict` for an iff statement when `s` is
closed.) -/
theorem locally_integrable_on_of_locally_integrable_restrict [opens_measurable_space X]
    (hf : locally_integrable f (Î¼.restrict s)) : locally_integrable_on f s Î¼ :=
  by
  intro x hx

  obtain âŸ¨u, hu_sub, hu_o, hu_memâŸ© := mem_nhds_iff.mp ht_mem
  refine' âŸ¨_, inter_mem_nhdsWithin s (hu_o.mem_nhds hu_mem), _âŸ©
  simpa only [integrable_on, measure.restrict_restrict hu_o.measurable_set, inter_comm] using ht_int.mono_set hu_sub
#align locally_integrable_on_of_locally_integrable_restrict locally_integrable_on_of_locally_integrable_restrict

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `Â«expr á¶œÂ» -/
/-- If `s` is closed, being locally integrable on `s` wrt `Î¼` is equivalent to being locally
integrable with respect to `Î¼.restrict s`. For the one-way implication without assuming `s` closed,
see `locally_integrable_on_of_locally_integrable_restrict`. -/
theorem locally_integrable_on_iff_locally_integrable_restrict [opens_measurable_space X] (hs : IsClosed s) :
    locally_integrable_on f s Î¼ â†” locally_integrable f (Î¼.restrict s) :=
  by
  refine' âŸ¨fun hf x => _, locally_integrable_on_of_locally_integrable_restrictâŸ©
  by_cases h : x âˆˆ s
  Â· obtain âŸ¨t, ht_nhds, ht_intâŸ© := hf x h
    obtain âŸ¨u, hu_o, hu_x, hu_subâŸ© := mem_nhds_within.mp ht_nhds
    refine' âŸ¨u, hu_o.mem_nhds hu_x, _âŸ©
    rw [integrable_on, restrict_restrict hu_o.measurable_set]
    exact ht_int.mono_set hu_sub
  Â· rw [â† isOpen_compl_iff] at hs
    refine' âŸ¨Â«expr á¶œÂ» s, hs.mem_nhds h, _âŸ©
    rw [integrable_on, restrict_restrict, inter_comm, inter_compl_self, â† integrable_on]
    exacts[integrable_on_empty, hs.measurable_set]
#align locally_integrable_on_iff_locally_integrable_restrict locally_integrable_on_iff_locally_integrable_restrict
locally_integrable_on_iff:
/-- If `s` is either open, or closed, then `f` is locally integrable on `s` iff it is integrable on
every compact subset contained in `s`. -/
theorem locally_integrable_on_iff [LocallyCompactSpace X] [T2Space X] (hs : IsClosed s âˆ¨ IsOpen s) :
    locally_integrable_on f s Î¼ â†” âˆ€ (k : Set X) (hk : k âŠ† s), IsCompact k â†’ integrable_on f k Î¼ :=
  by
  -- The correct condition is that `s` be *locally closed*, i.e. for every `x âˆˆ s` there is some
  -- `U âˆˆ ğ“ x` such that `U âˆ© s` is closed. But mathlib doesn't have locally closed sets yet.
  refine' âŸ¨fun hf k hk => hf.integrable_on_compact_subset hk, fun hf x hx => _âŸ©
  cases hs
  Â·
    exact
      let âŸ¨K, hK, h2KâŸ© := exists_compact_mem_nhds x
      âŸ¨_, inter_mem_nhdsWithin s h2K,
        hf _ (inter_subset_left _ _) (isCompact_of_isClosed_subset hK (hs.inter hK.is_closed) (inter_subset_right _ _))âŸ©
  Â· obtain âŸ¨K, hK, h2K, h3KâŸ© := exists_compact_subset hs hx
    refine' âŸ¨K, _, hf K h3K hKâŸ©
    simpa only [IsOpen.nhdsWithin_eq hs hx, interior_eq_nhds'] using h2K
#align locally_integrable_on_iff locally_integrable_on_iff
locally_integrable_on_const:

locally_integrable_on:
/-- A function `f` continuous on a set `K` is locally integrable on this set with respect

    (hK : MeasurableSet K) : locally_integrable_on f K Î¼ := fun x hx => hf.integrable_at_nhds_within hK hx

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `Â«expr â»Â¹' Â» -/

theorem locally_integrable_map_homeomorph [borel_space X] [borel_space Y] (e : Â«expr â‰ƒâ‚œ Â» X Y) {f : Y â†’ E}
    {Î¼ : Measure X} : locally_integrable f (Measure.map e Î¼) â†” locally_integrable (f âˆ˜ e) Î¼ :=

    exact (integrable_on_map_equiv e.to_measurable_equiv).1 h'U

/-- If a function is locally integrable, then it is integrable on an open neighborhood of any
compact set. -/
theorem locally_integrable.integrable_on_nhds_is_compact (hf : locally_integrable f Î¼) {k : Set X} (hk : IsCompact k) :
    âˆƒ u, IsOpen u âˆ§ k âŠ† u âˆ§ integrable_on f u Î¼ :=

  Â· rintro s t hst âŸ¨u, u_open, tu, huâŸ©
    exact âŸ¨u, u_open, hst.trans tu, huâŸ©
  Â· rintro s t âŸ¨u, u_open, su, huâŸ© âŸ¨v, v_open, tv, hvâŸ©
    exact âŸ¨u âˆª v, u_open.union v_open, union_subset_union su tv, hu.union hvâŸ©
  Â· intro x hx
    rcases hf x with âŸ¨u, ux, huâŸ©
    rcases mem_nhds_iff.1 ux with âŸ¨v, vu, v_open, xvâŸ©
    exact âŸ¨v, nhdsWithin_le_nhds (v_open.mem_nhds xv), v, v_open, subset.rfl, hu.mono_set vuâŸ©

    (ht : IsCompact t) : integrable_on f t Î¼ :=

integrable_on_compact:
/-- A function `f` continuous on a compact set `K` is integrable on this set with respect to any
locally finite measure. -/
theorem continuous_on.integrable_on_compact (hK : IsCompact K) (hf : ContinuousOn f K) : integrable_on f K Î¼ :=
  by
  letI := metrizable_space_metric X
  refine' locally_integrable_on.integrable_on_is_compact (fun x hx => _) hK
  exact hf.integrable_at_nhds_within_of_is_separable hK.measurable_set hK.is_separable hx
#align continuous_on.integrable_on_compact continuous_on.integrable_on_compact

  (integrable_on_iff_integrable_of_support_subset (subset_tsupport f)).mp <| hf.continuous_on.integrable_on_compact hcf
